The claim about George Soros: companies providing voting machines for some states was debunked by fact-checking organizations such as Snopes and the Washington Post.
Smartmatic: the voting technology company mentioned in the claim, stated on its website that it would not be deploying its technology in any U.S. county for the 2016 presidential elections.
There is no evidence to support the clai: 4. Smartmatic's CEO Antonio Mugica and chairman Lord Mark Malloch-Brown have both denied any ownership or involvement of George Soros in their company, emphasizing that Smartmatic has no ties to political parties or groups and adheres to a strict code of ethics.
